title: Thomas Skinner Says BBC Cheated on Strictly Vote
summary: Thomas Skinner, a former contestant on the TV show Strictly Come Dancing, says the BBC cheated in the vote that made him leave the show. He got an email that he says was from a BBC boss, showing he got more votes than it looked like. The email also said the BBC was upset because he met a US Vice-President. The BBC says the vote is checked by an independent company to make sure it is fair, and they deny cheating. Skinner is not going to the show's final and says he wants people to know why. He says he checked the email was real, but the BBC hasn't seen it. This is a story about a disagreement over a TV show vote.

background_read: Strictly Come Dancing is a popular TV show in the UK where celebrities learn to dance and compete. Viewers vote for their favorite dancers each week. Sometimes, people argue about votes being fair. This story is about Thomas Skinner, who was on the show and says the BBC, which makes the show, cheated to make him leave. The BBC says they use a company to check votes to keep it fair. It's important to hear both sides in a disagreement.
